name: The Mini Penny Pinafore sewing pattern (6m to 10Y)
description:
This striking knit dress has princess seams, a banded neckline, a gentle a-line shape in two different lengths (tunic /  knee length), and options for banded cap sleeves or long sleeves.  The separate panels and princess seams give ample opportunity for fun colour-blocking and print mixing. In a single colour or overall print the dress lends itself to a casual wardrobe staple that's cute thrown over leggings or tights, or use a contrasting print or colour in the centre panels for a striking look.  The sizes included in the pattern range from 6m all the way through 10 yrs.  Due to the slightly challenging nature of sewing princess seams and easing different curves into each other, I would class this an adventurous beginner or intermediate pattern but essentially, it's a very quick sew.

The pattern itself prints over 13 pages, and the tutorial takes two streams: a full photo tutorial with hints and tips for visual learners and a shorter crib sheet for more experienced garment sewers.

For materials required and sizes covered, please see the second picture. For a visual representation of swagger, see the last picture.

This pattern is a PDF and not a paper pattern, you will need to print and assemble the pieces. An email is automatically generated and sent to your Paypal email after checkout.

**Please note that Kitschy Coo is a VAT registered business and this product is subject to VAT as a digital pattern. A VAT element of £1.20 is included in the price. This does not constitute a VAT receipt.**

name: The Penny Pinafore sewing pattern (for teens and women)
description:
This striking knit dress has shapely princess seams, a scooped banded neckline, a gently curved a-line shape in three different lengths (tunic / mini / knee length), and options for banded cap sleeves, ¾ length sleeves or long sleeves.  It's designed to flatter the figure with a close fit through the bust, subtle waistline shaping through the natural waist, and then gently skimming over the lower waist and hips.  The separate panels and princess seams give ample opportunity for fitting to individual shapes and adjusting to preferred ease. In a single colour or overall print the dress lends itself to a casual wardrobe staple that's cute thrown over leggings or tights, or use a contrasting print or colour in the centre panels for an striking hourglass shape.  There are eight sizes included in the pattern, ranging from a 30” to 44” high bust, and a 24” to 38” high waist.  Due to the slightly challenging nature of sewing princess seams and easing different curves into each other, I would class this an intermediate pattern but essentially it's a very quick sew.

The pattern itself prints over 30 pages, and the tutorial takes two streams:  a full photo tutorial with hints and tips for visual learners and a shorter crib sheet for more experienced garment sewers.

For materials required and sizes covered, please see the second picture. For how to take your measurements, see the third picture.  For a visual representation of swagger, see the last picture.

This pattern is a PDF and not a paper pattern, you will need to print and assemble the pieces.  An email is automatically generated and sent to your Paypal email after checkout.

**Please note that Kitschy Coo is a VAT registered business and this product is subject to VAT as a digital pattern. A VAT element of £1.20 is included in the price. This does not constitute a VAT receipt.**

description:

name: The Lady Skater sewing pattern (for teens and women)
description: This funky yet functional knit dress has a fitted bodice, scooped banded neckline, a curved flared knee-length skirt, and options for trimmed cap sleeves, or banded ¾ length sleeves or long sleeves. It's designed to flatter the figure with a waistline that hits at the natural waist and a skirt that gently skims over the lower waist and hips. In plainer fabrics the skater dress lends itself to a casual wardrobe staple that's cute with sneakers, or snag yourself a fancy fabric for a knock-out evening dress. There are eight sizes included in the pattern, ranging from a 30” to 44” high bust, and a 24” to 38” high waist. It's a perfect garment to make if you are new to sewing knits and very quick to sew up. The pattern itself prints over only 22 pages, and the tutorial takes two streams: a full photo tutorial with hints and tips for visual learners and a shorter crib sheet for more experienced garment sewers. For materials required and sizes covered, please see the second picture. For how to take your measurements, see the third picture. For an assortment of gorgeous ladies rocking their skaters, see the forth picture. For a visual representation of swagger, see the last picture. This pattern is a PDF and not a paper pattern, you will need to print and assemble the pieces. **Please note that Kitschy Coo is a VAT registered business and this product is subject to VAT as a digital pattern. A VAT element of £1.20 is included in the price. This does not constitute a VAT receipt.**

name: Little Girls' Skater Dress sewing pattern -18m/2T, 3T/4T, 5Y/6Y, 7Y/8Y - PDF
description: This funky yet functional knit dress has a fitted bodice, high neckline and a curved flared skirt. With a generous cut, the dress is designed to be worn for up to two years per size, here the skirt hits at the knee in the first year and just above the knee in year two. There are options for a sleeveless, short sleeve and long sleeve version, with bodice pieces drafted specifically for either sleeved for sleeveless . It's a perfect garment if you are new to sewing knits and very quick to sew up. I have bonus content on my blog with pattern pieces for 6-12m and 12-18m, as well as a tutorial for how to turn this into a peplum top! You can find it here: http://kitschycoo.blogspot.co.uk/search/label/skater%20dress%20bonus%20content Materials: 1/2m to 1m knit fabric in standard wide width depending on size you're making, if the print is directional, and whether you are including sleeves. Additionally, 1/4m knit fabric for neckband and (optionally) sleeve bands or sleeveless arm trim. name: Dolman tee unisex sewing pattern (18m/2T, 3T/4T, 5Y/6Y, 7Y/8Y) - PDF
description: The top has short dolman sleeves with the option of sleeve and hem bands or, if you prefer, straightforward hems. It is suitable for both boys and girls. With a generous cut, the top is designed to be worn for up to two years per size. It's a perfect garment if you are new to sewing knits, and it should take you under an hour to sew up! Suitable fabrics include interlock, jersey, rib knit, waffle weave knit, french terry, and sweatshirting, or you could even repurpose old adult shirts. ** Now added, a long sleeve version! The long sleeve option creates a mock double sleeve. The long sleeve pattern pieces and instructions can be found here: http://kitschycoo.blogspot.co.uk/2013/03/tutorial-adding-long-sleeves-to-your.html ** The sizes included are 18m/2T, 3T/4T, 5Y/6Y, and 7Y/8Y. You will need at most 1/2m of standard width fabric for all sizes / variations except for 7Y/8Y when choosing a normal hem and not a waistband (with a waistband it falls just short of 50cm). A 7/8 with a hem will require 3/4m of main fabric. Additionally, you will need 1/4m of ribbing, jersey or interlock for the neckband and optional sleeve and hem bands. This pattern is a PDF and not a paper pattern, you will need to print and assemble the pieces. **Please note that Kitschy Coo is a VAT registered business and this product is subject to VAT as a digital pattern. A VAT element of £1.20 is included in the price. This does not constitute a VAT receipt.**

name: Reversible Zippy Hoodie pattern UNISEX 18m/2T/3T/4T - PDF
description: This tutorial explains how to make a hoodie with a separating zip, ribbed cuffs and (optional) front pockets. The hoodie is fully lined with all seams hidden inside so if you use a reversible zipper you get two hoodies in one! With a generous cut, the hoodie is designed to be worn for up to two years per size, and there are also two length choices within each size for added flexibility based on whether your child is tall or average. It's a perfect garment for layering and for the transitions between seasons, and great fun for combining fabrics! It is suitable for both boys and girls. The sizes included are 18m/2T/3T/4T. Fabric requirements are dependant on which size you are making, the width of your fabric and whether or not the print is directional but you should be able to make a hoodie for all sizes with 1m of both shell and lining fabric. Additionally, you will require 1/4m of ribbing for the bands and a zipper measuring at least 12in (18my), 13in (2T), 14in (3T) and 15in (4T). This pattern is a PDF and not a paper pattern, you will need to print and assemble the pieces. The pdf will be emailed to you within 24 hours of your purchase. I will send it to your Paypal email address unless you stipulate otherwise. **Please note that Kitschy Coo is a VAT registered business and this product is subject to VAT as a digital pattern. A VAT element of £1.20 is included in the price. This does not constitute a VAT receipt.**

name: Boy cut brief unisex underwear pattern 2T/3T/4T/5Y/6Y - PDF
description: Tired of watching my kids constantly pulling at their underwear, I designed these boy cut briefs to offer more comfort and modesty than store-bought ones. The beauty of the design is a tall yoga waistband... no irritating elastic to dig into the waist and the added modesty of being able to wear the band up in the back to fully cover little bottoms. The body of the briefs is a single unseamed piece to reduce irritation. The legs are bound with knit fabric and not elastic so they stay put and there's no wedgies in sight! Although roomy enough for boy bits, this underwear design is also great for girls. Requiring less than half a yard of knit fabric for the main body of the briefs, it's a great way to use up scraps or even upcycle old t-shirts. The sizes included are 2-3yr, 3-4yr, 4-5yr and 5-6yr. **Please note that Kitschy Coo is a VAT registered business and this product is subject to VAT as a digital pattern. name: Reversible double breasted coat pattern and tutorial 18m/2T/3T/4T - PDF
description: This listing is for the tutorial and pattern to make a reversible double / single breasted coat of your own! The coat has an a-line shape, peter pan collar or hood, and can be folded up at the sleeve edges to get maximum length of wear. The coat is also fully reversible so you get two coats in one! Fabric requirements depend on the size you're making, the width of the fabric, whether you are making a hood or a collar, and whether print in directional, but a general guide would be between 1-1.5m of both shell and lining fabric. The full-colour tutorial explains the process step by step with easy to follow instructions and a pattern file to print and assemble. There are construction tips and hints as you go along. The pattern includes pieces for 18m/ 2T and 3T/ 4T. I would rate the difficulty as advanced beginner or intermediate. If you are interested in selling the coats that you make with this pattern, please contact me at amanda[!at] kitschycoo.co.uk for licensing terms. **Please note that Kitschy Coo is a VAT registered business and this product is subject to VAT as a digital pattern. name: Maia strappy slouch bag PDF sewing pattern
description: This tutorial explains how to make a Maia strappy slouch bag. There are instructions included to draft two sizes: big and slouchy or medium but generous. It is a celebration of straps.
